emotional_hook.prompt: Write a vivid, playful mini-scene about '{{Topic}}'. Use simple everyday metaphors linked to ADHD struggles. Short 2–3 line paragraphs. Insert a blank line after every emotional beat. End with a hopeful invitation.
emotional_hook.system_instruction: Generate only the Emotional Hook. Cozy, validating tone, playful ADHD-friendly language. Use short playful sentences (10–14 words max). Prefer simple vocabulary. Target Grade 6–7 readability (Flesch score above 60). Stay tightly anchored to '{{Topic}}'.

story_part_1.prompt: Write the first part of a playful Story-Based Explanation about '{{Topic}}'. Naturally mention '{{Primary Keyword}}' once in the first 100 words. Insert one playful mini-H3 heading (~150 words in). Use short paragraphs (2–3 lines max) and cozy, casual tone.
story_part_1.system_instruction: Generate Story Part 1 only. Prioritize vivid metaphors, playful ADHD-friendly tone, short cozy paragraphs, playful H3 after ~150 words. Use short playful sentences (10–14 words max). Prefer simple vocabulary. Target Grade 6–7 readability (Flesch score above 60). Stay tightly anchored to '{{Topic}}'.

story_part_2.prompt: Write the second part of a playful Story-Based Explanation about '{{Topic}}'. Mention '{{Primary Keyword}}' once early. Insert one playful mini-H3 heading. Keep paragraphs short (2–3 lines). Maintain cozy ADHD-friendly tone.
story_part_2.system_instruction: Generate Story Part 2 only. Continue playful storytelling with vivid metaphors, cozy ADHD-friendly tone, playful H3 after ~150 words. Use short playful sentences (10–14 words max). Prefer simple vocabulary. Target Grade 6–7 readability (Flesch score above 60). Stay tightly anchored to '{{Topic}}'.

story_part_3.prompt: Write the third part of the playful Story-Based Explanation about '{{Topic}}'. Mention '{{Primary Keyword}}' again naturally. Insert one playful mini-H3 heading. Short paragraphs (2–3 lines). End on an encouraging note.
story_part_3.system_instruction: Generate Story Part 3 only. Playful emotional wrap-up with vivid metaphors, cozy tone, playful H3 after ~150 words. Use short playful sentences (10–14 words max). Prefer simple vocabulary. Target Grade 6–7 readability (Flesch score above 60). Stay tightly anchored to '{{Topic}}'.

checklist.prompt: Create a playful, vivid, emotionally quirky checklist for '{{Topic}}'. 4–6 points maximum. Each point must use colorful metaphors or relatable imagery. Make readers laugh, nod, or feel seen. Short, cozy, ADHD-friendly phrasing (max 2 lines per point). Mention '{{Primary Keyword}}' naturally once if it fits.
checklist.system_instruction: Generate Checklist section only. Prioritize emotional vivid metaphors, playful cozy phrasing. Use short playful sentences (10–14 words max). Prefer simple vocabulary. Target Grade 6–7 readability (Flesch score above 60). Stay tightly anchored to '{{Topic}}'.

faq_sections.heading: Practical FAQs
faq_sections.prompt:
Write 4–6 FAQs about '{{Topic}}'. Use the exact phrase '{{primary_keyword}}' in each question. Format **strictly** using HTML:
Question

Answer

. No bullet points, no numbering, no Markdown. Output must be valid HTML only.
faq_sections.system_instruction: Generate pragmatic, search-optimized FAQs. Must use strict HTML formatting with <details> and <summary>.

faq_sections.heading: Curious ADHD Questions
faq_sections.prompt:
Write 4–6 emotionally curious or quirky ADHD-style FAQs about '{{Topic}}'. Format strictly using HTML:
Question

Answer

. Include one or two metaphors. No markdown, no numbering — just clean HTML.
faq_sections.system_instruction: Respond like a friendly guide with cozy emotional nuance. Use strict HTML structure.

faq_sections.heading: Want to Check Yourself?
faq_sections.prompt:
Write 1 FAQ that invites readers to take our free self-assessment for '{{Topic}}' at [QuirkyLabs.ai](https://quirkylabs.ai). Use cozy ADHD-friendly tone. Format strictly using HTML:
Question

Answer with link inside.

. No markdown formatting.
faq_sections.system_instruction: Gently encourage the reader to visit QuirkyLabs.ai. Use strict HTML structure.

cta.prompt: Write a soft, mischievous Call to Adventure inviting readers to explore '{{Topic}}' at [QuirkyLabs.ai](https://quirkylabs.ai). Frame it as 'charting their galaxy' or 'joining a fun quest'. Cozy, validating, adventurous tone. Mention '{{Primary Keyword}}' naturally if it fits.
cta.system_instruction: Generate CTA only. Cozy, playful adventurous tone inviting exploration. Use short playful sentences (10–14 words max). Prefer simple vocabulary. Target Grade 6–7 readability (Flesch score above 60). Stay tightly anchored to '{{Topic}}'.

validation.prompt:
Strictly evaluate the following blog content:

1. Emotional Hook vividness and relatability?
2. Story Parts must have playful mini-H3 headings approximately every 150–200 words — flag if missing.
3. Paragraphs must be short (2–3 lines max) with breathing space — flag if dense paragraphs appear.
4. Cozy, mischievous ADHD-friendly tone throughout?
5. Checklist must be vivid, quirky, and ADHD-friendly?
6. FAQ Section must have 5–6 playful FAQs with cozy emotional validation and playful tips?
7. CTA must feel like an adventurous invitation, cozy and mischievous?
8. Flesch Reading Ease score should be 50+ and Grade Level ideally 8 or below — flag if blog is too dense or hard to read.
9. Flag any missing sections or if overall flow feels dry, robotic, overly dense, or clinical.

Summarize all findings clearly. Mark blog as PASS only if all criteria are met tightly. Otherwise mark as FAIL.
validation.system_instruction: Strict QA validator for emotional flow, breathing space, vividness, ADHD-friendliness, playful H3 heading presence, readability grade, and section completeness.

topic_relevance_validation.prompt: Check if all sections stay tightly anchored to '{{Topic}}'. Allow some playful metaphors but no off-topic drift.
topic_relevance_validation.system_instruction: Strict topic anchoring validator. Allow mild metaphor usage but no major drift.
